semantic_title: Outpatient Surgery Coding - First-Listed Diagnosis Selection
section_path: Section IV > A. Selection of first-listed condition > 1. Outpatient Surgery

content.full_text: When a patient presents for outpatient surgery (same day surgery), code the reason for the surgery as the first-listed diagnosis (reason for the encounter), even if the surgery is not performed due to a contraindication. (Evidence: pg no: 112, L32-L34)
content.summary: Establishes coding protocol for outpatient surgery encounters, prioritizing surgical reason regardless of procedure completion (Evidence: pg no: 112, L32-L34)
key_concepts: Reason for surgery is always first-listed diagnosis (Evidence: pg no: 112, L33)
Rule applies even when surgery is not performed (Evidence: pg no: 112, L33-L34)
Contraindications do not change first-listed diagnosis (Evidence: pg no: 112, L34)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Code the reason for surgery as first-listed diagnosis for outpatient surgery (Evidence: pg no: 112, L33)
detailed_rules.explanation: The surgical indication takes priority as the reason for the encounter in same-day surgery settings (Evidence: pg no: 112, L33)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Apply rule even if surgery not performed due to contraindication (Evidence: pg no: 112, L33-L34)
detailed_rules.explanation: The reason for the encounter remains the surgical indication regardless of procedure completion (Evidence: pg no: 112, L33-L34)
common_applications: Surgery cancelled due to medical contraindications

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify the reason for the scheduled surgery
Step 2: Code the surgical indication as first-listed diagnosis
Step 3: Code any contraindications or complications as secondary diagnoses
Step 4: Document whether surgery was performed or cancelled

coding_scenarios.scenario: Patient scheduled for outpatient cholecystectomy, surgery cancelled due to elevated blood pressure
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Scheduled for laparoscopic cholecystectomy for cholelithiasis. Surgery cancelled due to hypertensive crisis.
step_by_step: Step 1: Identify reason for surgery - cholelithiasis
Step 2: Code cholelithiasis as first-listed diagnosis
Step 3: Code hypertensive crisis as secondary diagnosis
Step 4: Note surgery was not performed

correct_coding.rationale: Reason for encounter remains the surgical indication even when surgery not performed (Evidence: pg no: 112, L33-L34)

incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Coding the contraindication as primary diagnosis

warnings: Do not change first-listed diagnosis when surgery is cancelled (Evidence: pg no: 112, L33-L34)
best_practices: Always code the reason for surgery as first-listed diagnosis (Evidence: pg no: 112, L33)
Code contraindications as secondary diagnoses when surgery is cancelled
common_mistakes: Coding contraindication as first-listed when surgery cancelled
Failing to code the surgical indication when procedure not performed
tips: The encounter reason remains constant regardless of procedure completion
implementation_notes: Applies to all same-day surgery encounters
Documentation should clearly indicate surgical indication
clinical_context: Outpatient surgery may be cancelled for various medical reasons
Billing and coding reflect the encounter purpose, not just procedures performed
